newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch July-Aug manufacturing sales rise yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Dutch July-Aug manufacturing sales rise yr/yr.

text.p: Dutch July-August manufacturing sales were four percent higher than in the same period of 1995, the Central Bureau of Statistics said.

The CBS manufacturing sales figures refer to the guilder value of manufacturers' sales and are usually published one to two weeks before manufacturing production figures which show the rise or fall in volume terms.
Domestic sales rose by six percent in July-August, while the export increased by three percent, the CBS said.
The CBS said turnover increased most of all in the food and oil industry in the period July-August 1996 compared to the same period a year ago.

CBS said the biggest dip in turnover was in the paper industry in the period July-August 1996, down seven percent, while prices in the sector slipped by 12 percent, compared to the same period of 1995.
